metadata.title: CVE-2024-36890 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - medium
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:mm/slab: make __free(kfree) accept error pointers Currently, if anautomatically freed allocation is an error pointer that will lead to acrash. An example of this is in wm831x_gpio_dbg_show(). 171 char *label__free(kfree) = gpiochip_dup_line_label(chip, i); 172 if (IS_ERR(label)) {173 dev_err(wm831x->dev, "Failed to duplicate label\n"); 174 continue; 175} The auto clean up function should check for error pointers as well,otherwise we're going to keep hitting issues like this.

criterions.comment: linux package in noble is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '6.8.0-40.40').
linux-aws package in noble is affected and needs fixing.
linux-azure package in noble is affected and needs fixing.
linux-gcp package in noble is affected and needs fixing.
